intro: Epilobium oreganum, commonly known as willow herb, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in meadows. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy pink to purple flowers in clusters. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes other species like evening primrose and goldenrod. Epilobium oreganum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
